rundown: 3-4 L vs Washington Nationals Bryce Elder: 7.0 innings, 3 earned runs, 6 hits, 2 HR, 7 strikeouts Batters: Drake Baldwin (1 hits - 3 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Eli White (1 hits - 3 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) Marcell Ozuna (1 hits - 3 AB, 1 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves fell short in a close game against the Washington Nationals, losing by a single run. Despite a solid performance from Bryce Elder on the mound, the Braves' offense couldn't keep pace with the Nationals' scoring. Key highlights include: 1. Bryce Elder struck out 7 batters, showcasing his ability to dominate at times. 2. The Braves hit three home runs, one each from Drake Baldwin, Eli White, and Marcell Ozuna, but it wasn't enough to secure the win. 3. The Nationals capitalized on their opportunities, scoring 4 runs on 9 hits, ultimately outpacing the Braves' 3 runs on 6 hits.
